pullRequest.title: Bump jaeger version, to eliminate vulnerabilities
pullRequest.bodyText:
Exclude annotation-api 1.3.2, which has been banned, but is pulled in through thrift 0.13.
Exclude and fixme about annotation-api might not be the best approach. Any thoughts?

nodes.bodyText: Usually, we put the exclusion here: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/master/extensions/jaeger/runtime/pom.xml#L28 and we also add the corresponding jakarta dependency as that's what we want to use now.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -2023,6 +2023,13 @@
                 <groupId>io.jaegertracing</groupId>
                 <artifactId>jaeger-thrift</artifactId>
                 <version>${jaeger.version}</version>
+                <exclusions>
+                    <!-- fixme, jaeger-thrift 3.43.3 pulls in a banned version of annotation-api, so we exclude for now-->
+                    <exclusion>
+                        <groupId>javax.annotation</groupId>
+                        <artifactId>javax.annotation-api</artifactId>
+                    </exclusion>

commit.message:
Bump jaeger version, to eliminate vulnerabilities.

Exclude annotation-api 1.3.2, which has been banned, but is pulled in through thrift 0.13.
